page.title: 10Local Government.
page.content: Around{Kegworth}local{government}is the responsibility of separate bodies. The smallest of these is the{Kegworth {Parish Council,}next the{District {Council}and last the{County Council. {The councils are made up of}members each elected for 4 years. A well known Parish Councillor is{Mr W. Westhead, {headmaster of the village}school. He is{Chairman}of the{Finance Committee {and has been a Parish Councillor}for 20 years.{Mrs Pendleton}is a{District {and County Councillor,}she is also the Vice Chairman of the{Housing {Committee.}She has been a{District {Councillor}for 2 years and a{County {Councillor}for 1 month. The{District {Council}decides on planning, housing, parks and pavements while the{County {Council}decides on Education, Social Services, Agriculture and county-wide planning. By Kegworth Junior School.
